summary: The bill, titled the "Expanding Access to Lending Options Act," proposes to amend the Federal Credit Union Act. It aims to grant the National Credit Union Administration (NCUA) more flexibility in setting loan maturities for federal credit unions. Specifically, it seeks to extend the maximum loan term from 15 years to 20 years, or longer as the NCUA Board may allow. The bill emphasizes the importance of safety and soundness in the NCUA's oversight of credit unions.
